newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 sets fifth consecutive closing high.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 sets fifth consecutive closing high.

text.p: Britain's FTSE 100 index leapt to its fifth consecutive record close on Thursday, inspired by gains on Wall Street, despite a sterling-related profit-warning from the UK's biggest industrial conglomerate.

"The last couple of days have seen a few profit warnings and downgrades in some pretty significant stocks," said Ian Williams, UK equity strategist at Panmure Gordon. "But the market just keeps on going up, which shows how strong it is."
The leading FTSE 100 index closed at an all-time high of 4,580.4, up 42.9 points, after being down around 20 points at its worst.
